page.title: 18Housing In Dentdale.
page.content: There are about 300 houses in Dentdale,some of these are holiday homes, sadly not lived in all the year round.Most of the houses are between 100 and 300 years old,being built of local stone,like the dry stone walls which surround them.The houses blend into the natural beauty of the dale. Although the houses look old from the outside the insides contain all modern amenities such as central heating,flush toilets,bathrooms , electricity,hot and cold water.Gas has not been piped to Dent but most people burn coal on their fires.Comfort with low beamed ceilings,antique furnishings are all part of life here. There are just a handfull of pebbled dashed houses built before the Yorkshire National Parks stepped in.Other houses built in the traditional style are being planned.
